column5: Thought I'd share our special father & son moment...we left the boat in the garage to throw a few spoons in the river at Grandpas house and hooked into this "monster"  He did as well as a 2.5yr old can do to reel it in, with a little help from Dad  .  I've never seen a kid so excited until it came time to hang onto it for the photo op. and found it was "too slimy Dad" LOL!  He was happy it swam away for us to catch another day.  Pic quality is not great due to using a cell but you'll get the idea.
Well done......I love those special father/son moments!   dk
Way to go!   for your son catching his first fish and he looks so adorable!  I am sure that it was a great day for the both of you Dad!
That's great!
very cool, thanks for posting the pic!
Great post.  Hope it's one of many more to come for you and your son.
that's going to be one of the moments he'd remember when he grows up!  thanks for sharing with us!
That's what it's all about Andy!
That's an amazing accomplishment.  At that age if I caught something like that, it would've been the talk for weeks. It sure looks like a biggun.
that's great!!  a toothy critter to start to boot.   you're gonna have a muskie hound on your hands.
thats great, my little man just turned 2 yesterday, he's got the sponge bob combo now, just gotta work on his casting accuracy lol.  something that you will always remember.  jason
Nice!!! 2 and a half years old, you gotta love that. I think you will have a new fishing partner that you can groom over the next few years. I hope you guys enjoy a lifetime of fishing fun.
Nice moment Landlocked, thanks for sharing.  Wait now though til he finds out about BPS and the joys of visiting the local tackle shop.
Thanks for the comments everyone...sure making us feel great here!!
does it get any better then that?  I don't think it does.  Cheers!
Awesome!  Charles
Great job, congrats and he'll be hooked for life now.
Ah a future OFNer!!!! A father's proud moment!!!
Thats great, I have a picture of my sons first fish on the wall and I plan on it being there for the rest of my life. Now I just have to add my 2 year old daughters first fish to the wall to.
Wow...my first fish was a 3 inch sunfish...your son gets a pike!!!  LOL.  Great job...I'm sure we just saw a pic of your regular fishing partner one day....
Great work !  Easton
